definitions.definition: to take or hold somebody/something with your hand suddenly or roughly
definitions.sensetop: grab somebody/somethinggrab somebody/something by somethinggrab something from somebody/something

examples.text: She grabbed his arm as he got up to leave.
She grabbed the child's hand and ran.
He **grabbed hold of** me and wouldn't let go.
Someone grabbed me from behind.
He grabbed Tom by the collar and dragged him outside.
Jim grabbed a cake from the plate.
Don't grab—there's plenty for everyone.
He grabbed hold of a handrail to save himself from falling.
Somebody tried to grab her handbag from her.

definitions.definition: to try to take hold of something

examples.text: She grabbed at the branch, missed and fell.
I grabbed at his arm as he ran past.
Kate grabbed for the robber's gun.

definitions.definition: to take advantage of an opportunity to do or have something

examples.text: This was my big chance and I grabbed it with both hands.
He'll grab at any excuse to avoid doing the dishes.
He'll grab at any excuse to avoid hard work.

definitions.definition: to have or take something quickly, especially because you are in a hurry

examples.text: Let's grab a sandwich before we go.
I'll grab a bite to eat in town.
Grab a cab and get over here.
I managed to grab a couple of hours' sleep on the plane.
**Grab a seat**, I won't keep you a moment.

definitions.definition: to take something for yourself, especially in a selfish or greedy way

examples.text: By the time we arrived, someone had grabbed all the good seats.
She's always trying to grab the limelight.
I'll see if I can grab the waitress and get the bill.
Glasgow’s drugs problem has **grabbed the headlines tonight** *(= been published as an important story in the newspapers)*.
The play grabs the audience’s attention from the very start.

definitions.definition: to take a picture from a television or video film, or from a computer screen, and store it as an image on a computer

examples.text: You can use this keyboard shortcut to grab part of the screen.

definitions.definition: used to ask somebody whether they are interested in something or in doing something

examples.text: How does the idea of a trip to Rome grab you?

wordOrigin: late 16th cent.: from Middle Low German and Middle Dutch grabben; perhaps related to grip, gripe, and grope.
